clues.text: "The Sorcerer's Apprentice", in which Mickey Mouse causes magical mayhem, was one of the short films in this animated feature
This movie is named after the falling speed of cherry blossom petals
This 1996 Disney film is based on a Victor Hugo novel of the same name
This 1988 Studio Ghibli film was released with 'My Neighbor Totoro' as a double feature
Dory tries her hardest to remember this address in hopes of finding Nemo
This skateboarder landed the first "900" in 1999
At the 2018 Winter Olympics, this snowboarder became the youngest woman to win the gold medal for halfpipe
As of 2019, this tennis player has more Grand Slam titles (23) than any other player in the Open Era
In 2018, this runner became the first person complete a marathon in under 2 hours.
Along with her teammate Misty May-Treanor, this woman holds the record for longest winning streak (112 matches) in beach volleyball
"Beam me up, Scotty!" This actor played James Tiberius Kirk in 2009's "Star Trek"!
This 2005 Christopher Nolan film tells the story of two rival magicians
Known for his role as Captain America, Chris Evans also portrayed this Marvel superhero
Though this actor has appeared in over 100 movies, he is perhaps best known for being the subject of celebrity impressions
Chris Pratt portrays "Parks and Rec"'s Andy Dwyer, who is the lead singer in this band
This Titan was punished for stealing fire for the sake of humanity
The Roman god Hercules was known by this name in Greek mythology
A central figure in the Trojan War, this person killed Achilles with an arrow to the heel
This wise Greek goddess was born from Zeus's forehead
After being imprisoned on the island of Crete, this man crafted wax wings to escape with his son Icarus

single.name: HEY SIRI, WHICH ROCK BAND IS THIS?
single.comment: clues are song titles, answers are the band that released the songs

crushcrushcrush

In his YouTube series, Gordon Ramsay completes this classic dish with a dollop of creme fraiche
Light Yagami dramatically eats this snack in an infamous scene from "Death Note"
Masaharu Morimoto is one of the recurring competitors on this Food Network program
clues.answer: Iron Chef America (Iron Chef is acceptable)

clues.text: While unemployed, Ben Wyatt from "Parks and Rec" envisioned a healthy Italian fast food chain with this name
Stormtroopers and Ewoks duke it out on this planet in a galaxy far, far away
This hormone is secreted during exercise and produces a feeling of euphoria

This British research vessel, commanded by Captain James Cook, was the first ship to reach the eastern coast of Australia
This actress is known for her roles as Katniss Everdeen and Mystique
Jennifer Garner plays the titular role in this 2005 superhero movie
Starring opposite Russell Crowe, Jennifer Connelly portrays the wife of John Nash in this biopic
Also an accomplished singer, this multi-talented actress has starred in movies such as "Shall We Dance" and "Selena"
Rachel Green, portrayed by Jennifer Aniston, regularly hangs out with her friends at this New York City coffee shop
Due to COVID-19, UC Berkeley's 2020 graduation ceremony was held virtually in this block building game
Although he is known for his peaceful protests in real life, this leader is ultra aggressive in Sid Meier's "Civilization"
Mario's archnemesis Bowser, also known as the King of this species, has a penchant for kdinapping Princess Peach
Throughout the Final Fantasy series, this adorable bird is used as mode of transportation
Known today for its video games, this company originally started out by making playing cards
At 282 feet below sea level, this is the lowest point in North America. It also has the highest recorded temperature on Earth
Twice as high as Mount Everest, this volcano is the tallest mountain in the solar system
Before Oganesson was discovered in 2002, this element had the highest atomic number amongst the noble gases
This vocal range is considered the lowest female vocal range, between F3 and F5
This former Google engineer holds the record for the highest human freefall at 135,890 feet in the stratosphere
On his eleventh birthday, Harry Potter buys a wand with this type of core from Ollivander
Before he received his Firebolt, Harry used to play Quidditch on this type of broom
Aberforth Dumbledore has a strange obsession with this animal, even possessing a Patronus with its shape
Although he is a devoted company man, Percy Weasley is only known to his boss Barty Crouch Sr. by this name
An avid proponent of house-elf liberation, Hermione Granger is the founder of this organization, called S.P.E.W. for short
clues.answer: Society for the Promotion of Elfish Welfare

clues.text: Before he became Gollum, this hobbit-like creature lived a normal life in Middle Earth
After a life of adventure, Kvothe from "The Name of the Wind" settles down in this type of establishment
This fictional metal grants the person who ingests it the ability to see the future in the Mistborn universe
Lucy, Edmund, and Eustace sail the eastern seas with King Caspian in this ship
This female elf occasionally teams up with Artemis Fowl in the "Artemis Fowl" series
Known in some cultures as the "King of Fruit", this fruit is sometimes banned from trains and hotels
